inn1.comm: pitched up and just a shade outside off, no swing, tapped gently into the covers
back of a length, veering into the hips, flicked away behind square on the leg side
good length and nips back in, played back to the bowler
Dawlat pushes it full outside off, gives it a chance to swing, it weaves away slightly past the outside edge
Dawlat strikes in his first over. Banged in short and kicks up outside off, Sarkar looks to pull. Loses his shape and ends up flapping a catch into the hands of midwicket. Simple catch
back of a length and cramps him for room, dabbed towards midwicket, all along the ground
friendly half-volley, swings into the pads, sweetly flicked away through midwicket with the wrists, for the first boundary of the day
off-side wide, signs of nerves for Naveen-ul-Haq?
tight line on off, defended into cover on the front foot
full tempter outside off, Tamim thought about the drive before belatedly shelving it
good length on middle, no swing, Tamim stretches forward and drives it to mid-off
overpitched and outside off, Tamim slaps it away through the off-side gap for four. Classic extra-cover drive
back of a length and attacking middle stump, patted to cover on the back foot
helped down to third man
back of a length on middle, defended again
late inswing into the left-hander's pads, chipped over square leg
another inswinger into the pads, the length is too full, Tamim bends forward and puts it away through backward square leg with another flick
floats it full and across the left-hander, defended back down the pitch with a straight bat
lucky to get away with a gentle half-volley, crunched straight to extra cover
too full on the pads, flicked straight to midwicket, no timing whatsoever behind that one. Perhaps late on the stroke
low full toss outside off, he presses forward and creams that between cover and point. Found that off the middle of the bat. No chance once it crosses the 30-yards circle here
hops back and whips it off his hip towards deep backward square leg
solid drive, but straight to mid-off
prods forward half-heartedly, get a thick inside edge that trickles down to fine leg
beaten on the drive to an away-going delivery. Feet nowhere to the pitch of the ball, simply swung through from the crease, clearly late on the shot as well
mistimes a pull past midwicket, played that off the front foot
sliced over cover, the ball just manages to trickle over the ropes. Not entirely a half-volley, he somehow managed to get underneath that one to slice that over the infield
delightful square drive, opened the bat face late to guide it past the infield to square third man
risky stuff, goes across a touch to defend the incoming length ball to midwicket
gets forward and offers a dead bat
drifting into middle and leg, worked towards square leg
driven back to the bowler with the spin
superbly tossed up, Tamim has to get a full stride in to defend that, hit wide of the cover fielder
waits inside the crease and defends it back down the pitch
skids on from middle, punched to mid-on

lucky escape. Hint of width, he slashes hard and just manages to get it over the outstretched hands of the slip fielder. Zadran is disappointed and he has every reason to be. Mohammad Nabi the fielder in question.
stifled appeal for lbw, but the ball was swinging down leg side, apart from the fact that there was a thick inside edge as he looked to work it to the on side
uses the depth of the crease to work the short ball to the leg side
nearly lobbed to cover, just chipped it gently
gets forward and dabs it back down the pitch
too full, he manages to get down on one knee and sweep that fiercely into the square leg boundary
nips away from length area on middle, guided to point
pats it gently to the man coming in from short cover and scoots across for a quick single, good understanding between both batsmen. Just an eye-contact and they were off

he's living dangerously today. Wanted to glide it a lot squarer, just manages to ease it past the diving slip fielder. Nabi the man once again. The ball was dying on him, so can't technically call that a chance
chopped off the backfoot to point
gets back into the crease to bunt an away-going delivery to point again
driven with the spin to long-off
drifts back in from wide of the crease, played back down the pitch
shapes to cut, not much room, finds the cover point fielder
gets to the pitch of the ball and eases it down to long-off to bring up their fifty
looks to drive inside-out over cover, ends up hitting it straight to the fielder
pushed through quicker on middle, pushed back down the pitch
worked into the on side for an easy single
excellent stop by Nabi at mid-off, it was firmly driven, he moved swiftly to his right before dishing in a dive to cut that off
short ball on the rib cage, Tamim negotiates that well as he drops his wrists and plays it gently to the off side
slower and fuller on leg stump, defended back down the pitch
appeal for lbw, gets it to swing back in late, but I suspect there was an inside edge. Kayes also pointed his bat to the umpire. Afghanistan were extremely confident
put down at backward point.  Bursts through Hasmatullah's hands, runs down to square third man. He was completely off balance, Ashraf is angry
beaten by a peach that leaves him late, Kayes pushed at the ball from the crease, whizzed past the outside edge
pushes outside the line, gets an inside edge onto the pad
looks to thump that over mid-on, gets a thick inside-edge to midwicket instead
timing to perfection. Short, he picks the length early, swivels back and pulls him into the deep square leg region
looks to smash the cover off the ball as he plants forward to drive, gets a thick inside edge to mid-off
slower delivery which may have slipped out of his hand, Kayes could have really played it wherever he pleased, ends up steering it straight to point
super stop at cover. Four written all over it until Hasmatullah threw himself to his left to pull off a one-handed stop
too full on the pads, worked wide of midwicket for a quick single

that to me is the shot of the afternoon. This wasn't all that full, but he was simply happy to hit through the line. Leant forward, used the width to thump that on the up. Raced away on this fast outfield
hops back and pushes the away-going length ball straight to point
too short and way down leg, Kayes looks to tickle it fine but misses
gets forward and plays a neat forward defense
punched straight to cover
lobs a full toss on middle, bunted down to long-on for one
another full toss, this is on the leg stump, flicked away to deep midwicket
good length ball, turned to the leg side
darted short on leg, wrong'un, misses the pull and wears it on the thigh
tickled off the hips to short fine leg
tossed up on middle, inside-edged back down the pitch
back of a length on off, stands tall and punches straight to extra-cover
length and angling away outside off, opens the face and runs a single to third man
pitched up and angled in, encourages Tamim to drive. He ens up stretching forward and skewing an inside edge to mid-on
pitched up and angled in, tapped to cover
full and angled into the leg stump, patted to mid-on
stands up tall to a short ball outside off, forcing it away to sweeper cover
dropped fraction short and outside off, short-armed away past the square-leg umpire
wrong'un leaves the left-hander outside off, poked feebly, does not carry to slip
Rashid gifts another full toss outside off, this is crunched through extra-cover, sweeper had no chance
worked off the pads to square leg
good length wrong'un, steered to short third man
tossed-up legbreak, inside-edged back to Rashid
chopped on! Tossed up and drifts into the left-hander, he is cramped for the drive. Yet, attempts the shot, and only manages a soft inside-edge that rolls onto the stumps
lobbed up outside off, reaches out and drives it to extra-cover
short and slides on outside off, chopped on the back foot through the covers
pushed through outside off, slices a drive to point

deflected off the pads to short fine leg. Tamim wants a single, there is a mix-up. He dishes out a full-length dive, the throw from Naveen-ul-Haq wasn't accurate. Afghanistan needed a direct hit there
takes this from outside off and drives it down to long-off
slower through the air on the off stump, opens the face and plays it to point
tosses this legbreak outside off, driven to extra-cover
dipping full toss, driven down to long-on
looks like a googly outside off, punched on the back foot through extra cover
heading down leg, wide
lovely legbreak outside off, pitches outside off and spins past the outside edge
good length, straight on middle, camps back and tucks to midwicket
slipping down leg, wide from round the wicket
flighted and outside off, eased through extra-cover
offbreak on off from over the wicket, defended
full and straight, flicked to short midwicket
flat and fast outside off, forced to sweeper cover
length ball on off, steered in the gap at the covers
attacking the stumps, punched back at Nabi
pushed through on middle and leg, raps the pad, but may have not carried on to hit leg. The lbw appeal is shot down
slider on middle, defended on the back foot
short and outside off, Tamim leans back and late-cuts past backward point. He reaches his fifty off 63 balls. Well done,Tamim
wrong'un, steered to point
skidding into the pads, tickled fine to the left of short fine leg. The fielder ended up diving over the ball
tossed on middle, flicked around the corner to square leg
sprays this wide outside off
length and outside off, Tamim presses forward and drives it powerfully on the up, to mid-off's left
back of a length on off, cramped for room, guided to backward point
short on middle, turned to midwicket for a well-judged single
full and shoots low on the off stump, he stoops low with it and keeps it out
leg-stump ball, flicked to fine leg
banged in short on middle, gets on top of the bounce and controls a pull to deep midwicket
flighted full on middle, driven down to long-off
offbreak, not much turn, defended
tossed on the middle stump, driven down to long-on
stump-to-stump line, defended on the front foot
full and outside off, steps forward and drives it crisply past diving extra-cover, long-off hunts it down
good length on middle, dabbed towards point
back of a length and outside off, steered away, diving save at backward point
Mahmudullah runs at Ashraf, takes a length ball from outside off and lifts it over mid-off. Clean swing. First six of the day
back of a length offcutter, grips in the surface, chopped to off
short and outside off, stabbed to extra-cover
tight line on off, back of a length, defended
nice and full outside off, opens the face and guides it to point
quicker on the off stump, defended
pushed through outside off, slices a drive over backward point
flatter and quicker on off, defended to cover-point on the back foot
non-turning ball on off, pushed to point via an open face
back of a length, cramps him for room, played back
dangled on the leg stump, draws an lbw appeal, think it did not straighten enough
back of a length and angled in on off, turned to midwicket
cutter on middle, grips in the surface and kicks up at Tamim, he fends, and ends up gloving it to the off side
full ball on the off stump, Mahmudullah goes across the line. He had ample time to do so. Hacked over midwicket
overpitched outside off, gets forward and plays a flowy drive to long-off
slides on the off stump, run away behind square on off
turn and bounce outside off, just enough to beat the outside edge
length ball on off, played back to the bowler
slides on middle, worked to midwicket
googly, snakes back into Mahmudullah. He did not pick it at all. Stays back to this and manages an inside edge onto the pad
flatter and outside off, punched square through the off side, breaks what could have been a maiden
back of a length and angled in from over the wicket, Mahmudullah hangs back and clips through square leg
veering into the thigh, deflected to short fine leg
short and just a shade outside off, punched to mid-off
slower one outside off, waits and carves to sweeper cover
back of a length on middle, played into the off side
good length offbreak on middle, hangs back and turns it to square leg
cut from the stumps to swepeer cover
flighted on the off stump, forward and driven down to long-on
tossed on middle, Tamim comes down the pitch and chips it in front of long-off
slides on outside off, beats the outside edge
flighted on middle, tapped down to long-on
half-volley on middle, driven straight down the track, past the bowler's outstretched hand, hits the stumps at the non-striker's end
picked off the pads through backward square leg
chipped over midwicket as he was not close to the pitch of the ball
back of a length on off, jabbed to sweeper cover
slower one on the pads, tickled to short fine leg
back of a length on middle, hit down the ground
slogged away to deep square leg
lobbed up on middle, driven inside-out through extra-cover
flat and turns outside off, punched to extra-cover on the back foot
tossed-up offbreak, stops on the batsman. Checks his drive and chips it in front of Nabi
much slower through the air, bunted down the ground, to long-on, for one
back of a length on off, flat-bat wallop to extra-cover
offcutter outside off, misses a big slog over midwicket
leans back, waits on the slower delivery outside off, late-cuts to backward point
back of a length and outside off, Mahmudullah frees his arms and pumps it over extra-cover
off-stump yorker, good ball, whipped to midwicket
slower and wider outside off, jabbed to backward point for a scampered single
full and tailing back into middle, pushed down to long-on
covers the line of the stumps and defends it back to the bowler
bunts one to mid-on and calls for one almost immediately, had to really make a dash to get back in time, it's a different matter that there was no direct hit at the bowler's end

width on offer and Mahmudullah glides it late, beats the backward point fielder. Third man was no more than a few yards away from the ball, but so good was the timing that he had no chance. Beautiful!
uppish but safe, down to long-on for a single
plays a short-arm jab down to the man at deep backward square leg
fires one into middle and leg, squeezed back to the bowler
skids across from leg stump, tucked to midwicket
dabbed to short third man, too close for him to attempt the late cut, lucky break, ball could have so easily cannoned into the stumps
eased along the ground to long-on
touch short, he gets across the stumps and punches it straight to midwicket

loopy delivery on off stump, Mahmudullah had to stretch a long way forward to defend, which he does. These are the kind of overs Afghanistan need to string together if they are to build pressure on the hosts

he was denied a wicket earlier in the innings when a catch was put down at point, but he finally has his man. Tamim looks to slap this over long-off, but managed to get the toe-end of the bat. This time, he managed to hit it down the throat of the long-off fielder Naveen, who nearly over-ran it, but kept his composure to take it in the end. Wonder if their inability to turn the strike in the previous over played a part in this wicket. That's a wicket Afghanistan would gladly take at the moment
gets forward and defends the away-going delivery to the off side
hops back and bunts it wide of point to get off the mark
driven firmly but straight to extra cover
gets to the pitch of the ball and eases it down to long-off as they amble across for a single
too full and on the pad, flicked straight to midwicket. A metre on either side and they could have entertained thoughts of two
mistimes a sweep to short fine, he wanted to hit it a lot squarer
Hasmatullah throws himself full-length to his right to pull off an acrobatic stop at point,  four runs saved
there was a chance of a run-out as Hasmatullah picked up the ball cleanly from point, but the throw at the bowler's end was a wayward one, Shakib is lucky there

half-volley on the pads, he clears his front leg and lofts him over the infield, excellent work by Rashid at deep midwicket, the third umpire checked to see if the ball was pulled back in before he crossed the ropes, turns out he was in contact with the advertising triangle when he made contact
neat little flick, the ball was angling down and he clipped it easily into the vacant spaces at deep square leg
full and tailing back into middle, squeezed back to the bowler
picks the length early and pulls him imperiously in front of square, splits the gap between midwicket and mid-on. Half century as well

what timing! Dawlat sees him give him the charge and bangs it in short, by then Mahmudullah was smart enough to make some room and loft him through the line over long-on. It pinged the middle of the bat and sailed away.
looks for a single as he pushes it to mid-off, sent back
not much room to work with, punches the short ball to cover
pushed through quicker on middle, defended back down the pitch
makes some room and eases it wide of a diving cover fieldr
swept with the spin, but can't beat short fine leg

an opportunity has gone begging.  Simplest of chances put down by Stanikzai. He's pointing to the lights, but the fact is he was so late to react. The ball dipped on him at cover, and in the end he made a right royal mess of that
worked into the leg side for an easy single
gets a thick inside edge towards short midwicket
slower delivery on middle and leg, Shakib whips it off his hip towards deep square leg
slower and fuller on off stump, bunted towards the man coming in from point for a quick single
spongy bounce on that occasion, the ball stops on Shakib just a touch, he waits and waits before helping it down to deep square leg
swung across the line, mistimes it to mid-off as they scamper through for a single. Mahmudullah was looking to slap that over long-on
backs away, frees his arms and carves that over cover, the ball plonks near the boundary, enough time to run three
this time he's made clean connection. This was too full, he made some room and hammered that over extra cover. The boundary rider at long-off had no chance
backs away and chips it over the bowler's head, long-off had to come in a fair bit by which time they were back for the second
flatter one on middle and leg, whipped towards deep square leg

where did that come from? Mahmudullah can't believe what he's just done. The idea was right, but he didn't get enough bat on it. Walks across the stumps and sweeps a flatter delivery with the spin straight to Ashraf at deep backward square leg. He wanted to hit it a lot finer, but ended up dragging it a little. The ball was dying on Ashraf, but he adjusted well to complete the catch.
turned to midwicket, he wanted a run but was sent back
steps out and works it wide of point to get off the mark
shapes to pull, gets a bit of glove on that short bouncer, eludes the keeper and rolls down to fine leg
flicked towards deep square leg
clearly beaten for pace, it was a short bouncer which Rahim looked to fetch from off stump, got it a lot finer because he was late on the shot, lands in front of the fine leg fielder

swivels around and nurdles it towards midwicket. The bowler had to run across to prevent the second, but Shakib was lightning quick. Both batsmen were on collision course midway through the second, but they managed to change tracks in the nick of time
slaps a length ball on off straight to mid-off
half-volley on off stump, drilled to long-off
makes a bit of room and cuts a short ball on the stumps to deep point
fails to take full toll of the full toss, smeared to deep midwicket
squeezed to cover, wanted to get underneath the flight to loft, nearly ended up yorking himself
worked with the spin to deep square leg
cleverly done,  brings out the switch hit  this time. Lofted over short third man, once again the ball plonks and slows down near the boundary, Hashmat has enough time to pull it back in

deceived by the googly this time. Looks for an ugly slog sweep, but failed to get underneath it. He was already through with the swing even before the ball got to him, the middle and off stump is disturbed.

short, wide and he's hammered that into the cover boundary. The key to powering that through the off side lay in him finding the gap at cover, and he did just that. Backed away, rocked back and had plenty of time to drill that. Top shot
squeezed down to long-off for an easy single
squared up as the ball jags away a wee bit, defends to point
shuffles across and helps a short ball angling in towards square leg
lucky runs. He spears a yorker outside leg stump, Shakib digs it out and somehow the bottom edge flies over the keeper's head, hird man comes around to mop that up
punched to deep midwicket as they amble the single
makes a bit of room and squeezes the full delivery on middle towards sweeper cover
wrong'un again, this one was a touch short and so had a bit of bounce with it to beat Sabbir's swing and hit him high on the right thigh
takes it on the full and works it into the gap between deep midwicket and long-on, they decide against the second
looks to go over the top, gets a thick inside edge down to long on

another appeal for lbw, and the umpire thought long, before raising the finger. The bounce was in question here. It was another googly, Sabbir was stuck to the crease as he looked to whip it across the line. He was hit on the flap of the pad, and  replays suggest the ball may have missed the stumps.
Very, very close.  Mashrafe is hit on the pad as he stabs forward to the googly. The only thing that could have saved him was the impact. Was it outside? Yes, just outside.
had to chase a short ball bowled off the back of the hand, missed it. Keeper collects on the bounce
creamed over cover, takes it on the full and eases it down to the boundary rider. The fielder slipped as he bent down to stop that. Dew?
short down leg, swung down to long leg
excellent short ball on the body, except it doesn't lift off the surface as much as Mashrafe expected, he arched back to avoid it but ended up fending it to the off side for a quick single
slower bouncer but bowled way over the batsman's head, easy call
attempted yorker that tails back in to strike the pad and deflect towards fine leg. It was a low full toss, and he should have done better to get some bat on that
makes a bit of room and punches it down to long on
back of a length and on the hips, picked up and flicked strongly over square leg. Shakib is the key as Bangladesh eye a late surge
pulls pace off this outside off, nice change-up, Shakib checks his drive and ends up chipping it down to long-off
skiddy length ball on the leg stump, tucks Mashrafe up for room. He aims a leg-side clip and spoons a leading edge in front of extra-cover
cutter on the hips, Shakib just twirls his wrists and directs it to deep backward square leg
back of a length and straight in line, Shakib punches firmly, down the ground, with a straight bat
dishes out another leg-stump ball, calmly whipped away through backward square leg
full on the stumps, Shakib loads up and drills it straight down the ground, nutmegs the bowler. It was the slower one, and Shakib manufactured his own pace

Rahmat makes a mess of it at long-on. Back of a length on off stump, Mashrafe clouts it across the line. Hits it in the air. Rahmat was late to run to his right, misjudges the flight. He belatedly stretches his right hand after leaping. The white thing plonks a few inches behind. Just a a single

Shakib's wicket adds to the late slide. No fifty for him. Banged in short, rises outside off. Shakib had to fetch it from there, which means he can't control the slog-pull. Ends up skying a catch to deep midwicket. Good fightback from Afghanistan
veering down the leg side, might have kissed the thigh. Shahzad fumbles, and allows another extra. 2 wides
Zadran cranks it up and treats Mashrafe to some sweet chin music. He is caught in an awkward tangle, ends up arching his back and fending to point
another leg-side wide, brings up Bangladesh's 250
bouncer outside off, sails over the shoulder, the spongy bounce lavishly beats the hook
slower ball on the leg stump, Taihul patiently waits on it, then swivels on the back foot, pulling to long leg
length and outside off, uppishly punched down the ground, Bangladesh take two, slipshod fielding
good length on middle and leg, cramps him for space, tucked to midwicket
bouncer with loads of shoulder, Mashrafe shapes to hook but the ball climbs over him to Shahzad
length and outside off, Mashrafe backs away outside leg, slogs and miscues it high in the air. Rashid settles under that skier, running in from long-off
Taijul steps away outside leg, the bowler hits the deck hard, Banged in, soars to Shahzad. He can't nail the stumps down and catch him short
pitched up and outside off, chipped over mid-off
Taijul moves outside leg, he is chased by the bowler, punched through cover. An Overthrow allows the extra run
shapes to slog, loses his shape, and top-edges it down to third man
back-of-the-hand legcutter from Dawlat. Taskin could not spot the change-up. He aims a wild leg-side smite, early into it, and ends up dragging it back onto the stumps
another slower cutter, swings an inside edge onto the thigh
Taijul dares to run at Dawlat, he gets a short ball. Adjusts and shovels it over the top of mid-on for a boundary

Zadran finishes the innings with Taijul's wicket. Unfurls the back-of-the-hand legcutter again. Taijul seeks to loft it away. He can't get hold of it, can't impart enough power. Just spoons it in the air. Two fielders converge near the mid-off region. Rahmat ultimately takes it, Dawlat claims a four-wicket haul

inn2.comm: sprays it way beyond the wide line
nips away from outside off at length, he pokes his bat at that half-heartedly, lucky to not get a faint nick
hops back and dabs a short ball back down the pitch
whips a length ball from outside off, finds midwicket
pace first delivery, but it slides down leg side. Bowled at 140 clicks. Whizzed past even before Shahzad could react
put down by Imrul Kayes at slip.  Have to say it was a regulation chance. Shahzad saw the width and threw his bat at that, managed a thick edge that bobbled out in a split-second.
another pace short of length ball that nips back in to get the batsman hopping, but it was sliding down. Right call by the umpire
punched off the back foot to short cover
trying too hard, maybe? Pressure? Strives for pace and bowls another one down the leg side
much better this time, floats it full on off stump, pushed to cover
width on offer, but he fails to climb onto that one. Mistimes a cut to cover point
through the gate. He looks to whip that over midwicket, but left a big gap between bat and pad, the ball bounced over the stumps since it was pitched at length
gets forward and bunts an incoming delivery to mid-on
looks to force that through the off side but there was no feet movement whatsoever, beaten
hops back and across to defend the short ball with soft hands
this time he's picked the gap between cover and point. Touch short, Shahzad picked the length early, rocked back and punched it into the off side. Top shot
not in position to force that through the off side as he hops back to play the stroke, gets a thick inside edge back to the bowler
through with the pull, Mashrafe, being the tactician that he is, bowled a slow off-cutter that came back in to struck Shahzad on the ribs as he missed the pull. He seems to be in some pain too.
this is an authentic cover drive that should give him so much confidence. Half-volley outside off, Noori plants his front foot forward and simply eases that one into the gap.
gets a thick edge down to third man as he hops back to ease it behind point
beaten for pace. This was a rip-roaring bouncer aimed on middle, Shahzad was clearly late on the hook shot
worked off his hip towards square leg, both feet were in the air when he made contact
fetches the pull from outside off, but hits it straight to deep square leg
plays back to a delivery he should have been forward. Too full on off, defended to the man coming in from point
misses a whip off the hip, the ball deflects off the thigh pad towards square leg
risky, risky single, Tamim misses a direct hit at the bowler's end. Shahzad was deep inside his crease when he forced that to mid-off. Would have been gone had that hit, lucky break
gets this to nip away late from length outside off, Noori's bat face is angled as he looks to ease that into the off side, missed the edge by very very little
defended off the back foot to the point fielder

Rubel at mid-on has put down a chance running backwards.  Noori stepped out to play a short-arm jab, the ball got big on him but he still went through with the stroke. Rubel, at no stage, looked like catching that. He was off balance too when the ball bobbled out
dabbed gently to the off side, this time it was a slower delivery from the Bangladesh captain
lucky runs, but it doesn't matter how they come for Shahzad. Too late on the pull, it wasn't all that short as well, the ball flies off the edge and over the slip cordon
Shakib gives it chase from midwicket, seemed to have pulled it back, but replays suggest his foot was touching the advertising hoardings. This was a slap off the front foot by Shahzad
this time, he's in position to pull and has hammered that into the square leg boundary. He was camping back, almost as if he was expecting the short ball. The chase is on!
slides one down leg side, Mushfiqur dives low to his left to stop that. Pressure on Taskin
misses the cut this time, the ball was there for him to play the stroke, was a touch late on the stroke
low full toss on the pads, flicked into the gap at deep midwicket, good work by the man at deep square. Soumya Sarkar with a sliding stop
delightful punch off the back foot. Up on his toes as he played that with a straight bat, cover and mid-off converge to stop that. Good running too
slower delivery outside off, eased to backward point
worked off his hip towards deep square leg
well-disguised slower delivery, Shahzad bottom-edges an attempted big-hit over mid-off back to the bowler
stays inside the crease and somehow puts bat to ball on that short delivery, manages to hit it wide of point

sashays down the pitch and flicks it uppishly over deep midwicket. Shouts of catch, it was a question of who? A member of the ground staff took it rather well. Shahzad stood and watched the ball till it landed into his palms beyond the ropes, and then held the pose for the camera

the Bangladesh captain gives him a send-off with a few choice words. This was a slower delivery that gripped the surface, Shahzad looked to ease it past the keeper, but could only manage to glove that to Mushfiqur. Mirpur comes alive. That was a much-needed wicket for Bangladesh
drifts back in from around the stumps to beat Noori's forward stab and hit him on the pad
pushed to the right of Shakib, who runs across to stop the single

as far as decisions go, you have to say that's the simplest of the lot. With that  Shakib equals Abdur Razzak's record for most ODI wickets (207) for Bangladesh.  This was a typical left-arm spinner's delivery, an arm ball that kept coming back in to beat Noori's forward prod. He was plumb in front of middle. One brings two, they say. I agree
rocks back and plays the pull towards deep square
slow turn from outside off, punched to point
steps out and eases it with the spin to long-off
nicely played, behind the line to present the full face of the bat to defend it back down the pitch
worked off the back foot to midwicket
rooted to the crease as he looks to flick, gets a thick inside edge to deep fine leg
gets across the stumps to solidly defend that full-length delivery
watches a full delivery through to Mushfiqur, who fails to collect it cleanly. Landed on the half-volley
excellent work by Shakib to stop that well-timed punch at cover
stays inside the crease to defend a short ball back down the pitch
tucked wide of square leg for an easy single
mistimes a cut straight to point, couldn't get the placement nor power
skids back into middle, played to short mid-on. Pressure building
slow turn from middle, makes some room and crunches it straight to cover
drifting into middle, he leans forward and taps it back to the bowler. Top over
pitches it fuller and outside off, driven to the right of mid-off
good length on off, presses forward and pats it gently towards point
presses forward, opens the face of the bat, takes it from off stump and runs it to point again
Mashrafe drags his length back on off, Shahidi does not have enough room to employ the late-cut. Chops it to the left of the keeper
full ball on the stumps, not much pace from the bowler, checks his drive. Chipped well in front of the bowler. Five dots in a row
good length and outside off, he now has the width to steer it down to third man
full and shoots low on the middle stump, the batsman hangs back and keeps it out
tosses this up on the middle stump, draws the batsman forward. He topples over. The ball sharply breaks down the leg side for a wide
straight ball on off, plays for the turn, and outside-edges to short third man
slides on, no turn, defended
back of a length on the stumps, pushed back
much slower through the air, he is early into the leg-side flick. A leading edge dies in front of short extra-cover. The fielder dives forward, but it drops it in front of him
skids into the pads, tucked around the corner for one
back of a length and on the hips, flicked away towards midwicket
back of a length and outside off, back-foot punch to extra cover
similar ball outside off, similar shot, this time Rahmat threads the little gap between extra-cover and mid-off
banged in short and outside off, aims for a pull-flick and top-edges it fine over the leg side, does not carry to the fielder. Three fielders follow the ball, but it drops into no-man's land
skiddy short ball, swerves back in on the off stump, tucked up for room. Can't pull. Played back to the bowler
sliding into the pads, neatly picked off through backward square leg for a single
full on the pads, nudged to short fine leg
similar line, swept squarer of that fielder
tossed up and turns away outside off, uses his feet, but does not meet the pitch. Quietly blocked
full and outside off, driven to long-off
good length and holds its line outside off, Shahidi plays for turn and outside-edges it down to third man
pushed through outside off, crashed into the covers
back of a length outside off, punched into short extra cover
good length and angling away outside off, waits for the ball to come on and then guides it past diving slip, to third man, for a couple. Good running
Rubel grunts as he delivers this back of a length ball outside off, he uses the angle and runs it wide of backward point
banged in short on middle, tennis-ball bounce, half-pulled and half-fended away to midwicket
another effort ball from Rubel. Bouncer, has the batsman ducking, and handsomely sails over to the keeper
another big bouncer, too high, wide
slower cutter from Rubel, Shahidi attempts a flick to leg, does so early, popping a leading edge in front of extra cover
angled in on middle from round the wicket, played back
tossed up on middle, pushed down the pitch
down the track, gets too close to the pitch and jams it out
backs away and chops past extra cover
too full on the stumps, driven down to long-on
down the track, meets the pitch now, and bunts a single down to long-off
back of a length and around off, shuffles across and works it to mid-on
back of a length and outside off, steered with an open face to backward point
half-tracker outside off on this sluggish surface. He has ample time to rock back and smear it over midwicket with a pull
stands up tall to meet this shortish ball outside off. Punched to the covers
steep bounce, short outside off, top-edged over midwicket
sharp bouncer on middle, his head looks away from the ball. Top-edged  pull, does not carry to fine leg
pushed through on middle, sticks in the surface, checks his drive and chips over mid-on
length and outside off, pushed back to the bowler
dangled up slow outside off, flat trajectory, nearly chopped it back onto the stumps
short and slow outside off, Rahmat shaped to pull but shelved it at the last possible instant
lobbed up outside off, front-foot drive to long-off
non-turning ball on the stumps, hit down the ground
Rubel hammers the deck and sends down a bouncer, too high, soars over the ducking batsman, and the leaping keeper
back of a length and outside off, stops on the batsman, carefully punched through the off side
rocks back to meet a short ball. Pulled in front of short midwicket
this does not bounce at all! Full and keeps low on off, worked square through the leg side. Weak throw to the keeper, and the result is two
short and outside off, jabbed away to short midwicket
gets on top of a short ball outside off, gliding it down to third man
back of a length on off, cramps him for room, angled behind, just wide of the keeper
arm-ball, kept out off the back foot
chopped from the stumps to backward point. Rahmat made room and played a hard-handed cut
uses his feet, shortens his length, played back
lobbed just outside off, jabbed to extra cover
slider, angled in, punched down to long-on
flighted high on middle, driven down the ground
straight delivery on off, defended on the back foot
flat outside off, cut and a miss
full on the stumps, driven down to long-on
slower offbreak, down the track and pushed straight down the ground
lobbed up on a fourth-stump line, defended back
dug in short outside off, Shahidi picked the length early. Skips back nimbly and slams a pull over the midwicket region
stands tall, forces it from outside off to long-off
heading down leg, helped to short fine for scampered single
driven down to long-off
short and fired in on middle, hangs back and flips through square leg
down the track and clipped away, short midwicket throws himself to his left to stop the ball
slider outside off, punched back at Taijul
tossed on middle stump, swept away through backward square leg with a roll of the wrists
flat on the stumps, hangs back and works it square through the leg side now. Afghanistan reach 100
tossed full, bends forward and defends in front of off stump
short and turns away outside off, Shahidi cuts firmly, Kayes bends at backward point, and lets it through his legs for four
pushed through on middle, swept away to fine leg
down the track, gets a short offbreak, pushed to long-on
down the track and played through midwicket
inside-edged to the leg side
swept away to short fine leg
slides on outside off, late-cut to short third man
fired on middle, kept out
slightly short on middle, pulled through square leg
flat at off, defended back on the back foot
cuts this short ball from outside off to backward point
much slower through the air on middle, bends forward and smothers it
straight ball outside off, front-foot drive to extra-cover
sees some flight on off, skips down the track, extends his arms, lifting it down the ground for six. Mid-off was in the circle. He just hoisted it confidently over the fielder
back of a length on middle, punched down to long-on
shapes to cut, but there isn't much room, mistimed to cover
driven inside-out with the spin long-off
worked with the spin towards deep midwicket
skids onto middle, he delivers it from wide of the crease, played back to the bowler
poor ball, and he's lucky to get away with it too. Rahmat had all the time in the world to rock back and pull that into the vacant spaces at deep midwicket, he drags it to wide long-on instead
gets a good stride in to block that quicker delivery
leans forward and crunches the half-volley into the gap at deep extra cover, good running between the wickets. Sensible cricket from this pair
dug in short outside off, he hops back into the crease and then uses the pace to angle it down to third man
much fuller on middle and off, he plays back to a delivery he could have moved forward to, gets a thick inside edge to short midwicket
poor line, on the pads, clipped towards deep midwicket, he called for two as soon as he hit it and his partner responded. Rubel was late to get off the blocks
dug in short, but it was well over the batsman's head, square leg umpire indicates that
floats a fuller delivery into the left-hander in his quest to tuck him up, ends up being on off, drilled to mid-off
beaten by a peach that leaves him late, Hashmatullah had a poke at that but the minute deviation meant the edge was missed
deceived in flight, failed to get to the pitch as he defended that awkwardly
that should relieve him of any pressure. Tossed up on middle, he's down on one knee as he opens up his shoulders to swing that deep into the stands at midwicket. Muscular hit that
bowler deflects the drive with his left hand to cover, Rahmat wanted a single but was sent back
gets to the pitch of the ball and eases it down to long-off
misfield by Sabbir at cover gives them a single that wasn't on, pressure on Bangladesh suddenly
eased back to the bowler, that one was fired into middle from wide of the crease
swivels back to whip that off his hip to long leg
gets on top of the bounce and bunts the short ball to point
solidly behind the line of that length ball on off stump, pushed to cover
delightful stroke, punched off the back foot uppishly to deep point. He was in complete control as he made contact

as good as it gets. This is supreme from the left-hander. Elegance personified as he simply leans forward, to the pitch of the ball as the bat comes down in a lovely little arc as he creams that through cover
gets onto the back foot to defend, was cramped for room as well
slow turn from middle, chopped to cover
half-stop parries the ball to long-off. Shakib dived full-length to his left but got a bad bounce as it was punched back
sweeps and misses. Too early into the stroke, struck the pad on its way down leg side
quicker delivery on middle, defended back down the pitch
play and miss, looked to play a delicate little late cut past short third man
this time, he finds that fielder at short third man. Hit it too well
thick outside edge runs down to Shakib at third man
firm drive, but straight to cover. This was full and tailing away just a wee bit
slower delivery on the pads, flicked uppishly to deep backward square leg, a metre on either side and they would have got three more
punches the short ball to cover, it didn't bounce as much as Rahmat expected

this has come from nowhere, he has nonchalantly biffed that into the stands at deep midwicket to bring up his  maiden ODI fifty.  Length ball outside off and he swung across the line, generated tremendous power with the bottom hand
stands tall and punches it off the back foot to the off side
gets outside the line of the stumps and turns it with the spin to long-on
huge roar across the stadium  but it was a crowd catch. Drilled to cover, bounced as he made contact
quicker one on off, pushed to cover
gets outside the line of off stump to sweep that incoming delivery to short fine leg

poor delivery and punished. This was a freebie to say the least. Short, and way down leg side, it was sitting up nicely for Hashmatullah to swirl around and then help it over short fine leg. Superb execution
gets a good stride forward and  smothers the spin
short and wide outside off, crunched to deep point
length ball on the pads, worked wide of midwicket for an easy single
cover fielder dives over the ball to concede two when there should have been none, solid punch in his strokes
lofted over the bowler's head, didn't get to the pitch but he went through with the stroke, the ball plonked between long-off and long-on
checks his shot, wanted to split cover and mid-off initially, but Mashrafe slowed it down to force the late adjustment
gets a thick inside edge that rolls to deep midwicket
backs away and chops one to sweeper cover, it was the arm-ball and he somehow managed to get some bat on it
opens the bat face late to angle that one down to short third man for a quick single
slides one down leg, Rahmat wants to play an uppish sweep, but misses
driven back to the bowler, it as nicely tossed up outside off
slider into middle, the slowness of the pitch allows Rahmat to rock back and cut that wide of cover

lunges forward and drops it with soft hands to short cover to complete his  maiden ODI fifty . Afghanistan team is up in applause in the dug out, they know the value of this. They are dreaming big here
looks to pull but the ball skid back in to hit him low on the pad as it kept low. The ball was sliding down so there was no question of an appeal
there was some noise as the ball passed the bat, but it was of the bat hitting the strap of the pad, perhaps. He looked to glide it down to third man but it was too full for him to attempt that
taps it to the man coming in from cover, no chance of a single
pushed off the back foot to long-on
shows a straight bat to bunt that down the ground to long-on
opens the bat face late to angle the dull delivery on off stump to sweeper cover
looked to hit that into downtown Dhaka, missed it completely. It was a slower delivery outside off, he swung across the line too early

he's clobbered that and boy, that has been placed perfectly as it races away into the deep midwicket boundary. Too short and angling across, he was waiting on the back foot to fetch it from outside off and play it in front of square. Top stuff
floats it around the seventh stump outside off, mind games? Pressure on Bangladesh
lucky to get away with that short ball, guides it straight to the point fielder
camps back and angles the length ball to point again
forces one off the back foot, but can't pierce that off side ring, point fielder at it again
pulled behind square this time, straight to the boundary rider
play and a miss. Gets the ball to fizz, it reared on the batsman, who once again looked to get on top of the bounce and glide it behind point
floats one into the leg stump from around the stumps, tucked to midwicket
falls in no man's land. Nasir Hossain, the substitute fielder, was in business for a brief while at wide long-on, but the ball kept swirling away from him
bunted wide of cover as they steal another single, runs coming too easily
there's some grip off the surface this time, he looked to turn that leg side and got a leading edge, fortunately no fielder there
play and a miss. This one moves away just a wee bit, it was a touch too full as well for him to attempt a lazy waft at that
brings out a delicate little late cut this time, third man comes around to cut that off
gets this to skid onto him from length on middle, defended
makes a bit of room to open up the off side and ease it behind point to amble across for a single
superb improvisation! Gets inside the line of the ball and scoops it to the left of short fine leg. He was off balance when he made contact but managed to find the gap. Wow
drops it into the off side towards point for a quick single, a direct hit at the bowler's end could have been curtains for Rahmat
appeal for caught behind but the noise was that of ball brushing the thigh pad on the way through to Mushfiqur Rahim
pulled, but not timed all that well enough, lands on the bounce to Mahmudullah at deep backward square
slid through outside off, pushed back to the bowler
skidding into the thigh, eyes up a big heave and misses, heading down leg with the angle
attacking the stumps, played back
dangled outside off, late-cut to short third man, Four dots in a row
slides on middle, goes low, and sweeps to long leg
slower through the air, down the track, the ball dips, creating some distance between the bat and pitch. Checks his drive and taps it to extra cover
rolls on outside off, steps back and guides it down to short third man
fired on middle, hint of turn, inside-edged to midwicket
down the track, does not meet the pitch, reaches out and slaps it to extra cover
flighted outside off, chipped over extra-cover for one
speared outside off, hacked to midwicket

Has Mahmudullah dropped the match? This was back of a length and outside off, slogs across the line. Hits it in the air. Mahmudullah bends low but drops a sitter at deep midwicket. The ball bursts through and bobbles onto the ground
swept square of short fine leg

Shakib provides the hosts with the breakthrough and becomes Bangladesh's leading wicket-taker in ODIs. The batsman skipped down the track, Shakib slowed it up outside off.  He is nowhere close to the pitch. Has a wild swipe to leg and misses. Mushfiq does the rest
slider outside off, keeps low, defended to cover
skids into middle stump, kept out
drifts in on middle, ekes out an inside edge to short fine leg
turned around the corner, behind square on the leg side for two
flatter and outside off, punched back to the bowler
leg-side ball, helped fine on the leg side, past the keeper, outruns the chasing Tamim
fired into the pads, worked to midwicket on the back foot
tapped down to long-on for one
slower through the air, angled out to cover
backs away outside leg and belts this full ball down to long-off
banged short and outside off, leaps off his feet and upper-cuts over point. Shakib throws to Taskin who lets it through him
fuller in length and outside off, clears his front leg and pummels it through extra-cover
back of a length and on off, punched to extra-cover for one
banged in short, top-edges a pull over square leg
slower offcutter, checks his cut and chops to point
pretty full and outside off, driven down the ground for one
near-yorker on off, backs away and jams his bat down on the bal
length ball on off, lofted over the covers

Soumya hangs onto a catch and Mirpur erupts! Taijul takes the key wicket of Shahidi. This was pushed through fuller. He goes low and slog-sweeps it in the air. Gets more height rather than distance. Soumya snaffles the skier at deep midwicket
drifts in on middle, too full. Drilled back to Taijul
off-side wide
flat on off, hangs back and pushes a couple to long-on. Hares back for the second
sweeps from the stumps to short fine leg, beats the fielder, the ball skips away to the fence. The fielding from either side has been poor
back of a length and outside off, forced to sweeper cover
backs away outside the leg stump, meets a full toss and crunches it through extra-cover
steps outside leg again, this is pushed shorter and outside off, cut to sweeper cover
back of a length and tucks him up for room. Blocked towards midwicket
much fuller and outside off, Najib winds up and drills it straight of mid-off, races away
short and outside off, hops and glides to third man
short and wide outside off, slapped fiercely on the back foot through cover-point
full on middle from round the wicket, hit down to long-on
Mashrafe tightens the contest! Back of a length offcutter outside off. Najib slashes with hard hands and nicks it behind to Mushfiq
Stanikzai runs down the track like a raging elephant. Takes this back of a length ball and bashes it disdainfully over midwicket for six
back of a length and close to off, jabbed to the covers for one
back of a length on middle, shuffles across off and helps it away to short fine leg
flat and cramps him for room, pushed down towards long-on
shorter on off, chopped inches from off stump to cover
turn and bounce from a length outside off. Stanikzai shapes to cut, may have edged it. The ball bobbles out. Mushfiq was late onto the chance
pushed through on the stumps, kept out
tossed on middle, defended
chopped from off stump to point. Excellent over under pressure from Shakib
yorker on middle and leg, clipped down to long-on
full toss on the leg stump, whipped to long-on
off-stump yorker, squeezed past the bowler
Taskin strikes on return Short offcutter, grips in the surface. Nabi swings in the air. Can't impart enough strength holes out to long-off running to his left. Good catch
low full toss, hit down to long-on, the fielder slips, they take two
What an over from Taskin! He takes down Stanikzai. Good length and on a fourth-stump line. He slogs across the line and finds long-on. Taskin has his hands aloft in joy, Mirpur laps him up
full and outside off, carved over backward point
Shimmies out, yorks himself, squeezes back to Rubel
excellent blockhole ball, driven down to long-off
another acurate yorker, dug out to cover
full and outside off, Rashid, having shuffled across, falls over and ramps it fine of short fine leg
What was that Rashid? Good length and outside off, he pre-meditates another fine leg-side ramp. He topples over again. This time he deflects it onto the stumps
yorker on middle, jabbed down to long-on. They scamper back for two
pins him plumb in front! He shuffles across the off stump, eyes up the leg side with an expansive swipe. Misses this full, straight ball and sees the finger go up
full toss, thuds into the back thigh, they sneak a leg bye, this was slipping down. This lbw appeal is shot down
low full toss on off, jammed down to long-on. They come back for the second. The throw is to the keeper, Mushfiq takes the bails off. But Dawlat is just in
pretty full and just a shade outside off, Dawlat has an almighty slog, only to connect with thin air. Taskin has recovered well after a poor start
Bangladesh win by seven runs! Full toss on middle, Dawlat attacks it and ends up carving a catch to long-off running in
